title: [Large-scale] Reflective Practice Strategy Workshop for Digital Learning Environment Design: Considering Social Contexts

context.prior_knowledge: Experience operating secondary education curricula, proficiency in basic digital tools, and prior consideration of social variables (student backgrounds, community characteristics)
context.additional_context: A course for practicing secondary educators to improve learner-centered instructional design in digital environments. It particularly aims to enhance participation and civic literacy among learners from diverse social backgrounds (cultural, economic levels).

learning_goals: Learners propose at least three context-specific strategies reflecting learner needs analysis and sociocultural contexts (culture, economy, citizenship) when designing digital learning environments.
Learners diagnose and adjust real-time issues (e.g., learner relationships, rights protection) in instructional design processes using reflective practice (Reflection-in-Action) techniques.
Learners apply conjecturing strategies to derive creative solutions overcoming constraints (accessibility, digital divide) in digital learning environments.
Learners visualize and structure complex instructional design processes using external representations to collaborate with peers and community stakeholders.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
